result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:03 AM Defendant Justin J Korntved in court.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court for Justin J Korntved.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard are 22CF-129, 22CF-394, 22CF-20.

Court calls cases.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

Court addresses 22CF-394 first.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Defense waives time limits. 

Court addresses 22CF-129 next.
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Defense waives time limits.

At conclusion of pretrial, indicate on the sheet if a prelim has to be scheduled.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

records.addlTxt:
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney /s/ MDZ 09/20/22 
Defendant is Partially Indigent
Atty Adam Raabe appointed
Repayment of Attorney Fees at $100/month with first payment commencing on 10/07/22
Wage Assignment to be completed when the defendant gets employment

1:28 PM Defendant Justin J Korntved in court.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court for Justin J Korntved.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Cassidy calls case 22CF20 and states the appearances. 

Atty Raabe is ready to proceed with the motion hearing for 22CF20. 
Atty Cassidy responds and states the reasons why the motion should be denied. 
Atty Raabe makes statements regarding the reasons for the motion filed. 
Court states that the affidavit does not reflect the information Atty Raabe has provided that court today.

1:32 PM Atty Raabe calls Justin Korntved as a witness, and Mr. Korntved is sworn in by the Clerk. 
Direct exam by Atty Raabe.

1:36 PM Cross exam by Atty Cassidy. 

1:44 PM No re-direct questions from Atty Raabe. 
Mr. Korntved is excused from the witness stand by the Court.

Atty Raabe asks the Court to take note for transcripts for cases as stated on record and to admit into evidence.
Atty Cassidy objects to these transcripts being admitted into evidence for reasons stated on record. 
Atty Raabe makes arguments.
Court makes statements regarding hearsay. 
Atty Raabe responds further and makes arguments regarding residual evidence.
Court notes that the items are already in the file, have been reviewed by the Court, and the Court will allow to be in file, and referenced to for this hearing.
Court questions if that is sufficient as they are not marked as exhibits.
Atty Raabe agrees and makes further arguments regarding the motion.
Court questions Atty Raabe.
Atty Raabe responds and makes further arguments.
Atty Cassidy believes the defense has not met its burden today for arguments made on record. 
Court states that Atty Raabe has the final burden, so Court will allow final arguments.
Atty Raabe makes final arguments for this motion.

Court states findings for the record. 

BY THE COURT: Motion denied for collateral attack for reasons stated on record.

2:10 PM Court questions if cases 22CF129 and 22CF394 were called prior as they need to be addressed. 
Court states that Atty Raabe is not assigned to these cases but asks that he stick around for reasons stated on record. 

Court reviews the petition and letter from Justice Point in the case file. 
Court questions defendant regarding income and expenses to determine indigence.

BY THE COURT: Before considering court-appointed counsel, Mr. Korvtved is ordered to go the public defender's office within the next two days.
If denied for the public defender, Mr. Kornvted to bring the denial letter to the judicial assistant in branch 1. 

There is a problem with the Justice Point reporting as it appears there's non-compliance from Mr. Kornvted.
Court is giving Mr. Kornvted opportunity to fix before taking any action. 
Court explains that the Justice Point reporting is part of bond conditions.

BY THE COURT: Mr. Kornvted is ordered to go to Justice Point today.

Atty Cassidy questions scheduling for case 22CF20 with cases 22CF129 and 22CF394.
Court responds.

BY THE COURT: This matter to be set for a status hearing.
Cases 22CF129 and 22CF394 are to be set for an adjourned initial appearance.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:25 PM Defendant Justin J Korntved in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases 22CF129 and 22CF394.
Defendant states he has Attorney Adam Robi and has not heard from him

BY THE COURT: Bond is continued.

1:35 PM Defendant Justin J Korntved appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF394 and 22CF129.

Court questions case 22CF129; ADA Mutchler responds.
Defendant is not represented on either of the above cases.
Defendant is represented on his other case by Atty Raabe.
ADA Mutchler with request an adjourned initial appearance on each case. 
Defendant is informed to get in contact with Atty Adam Raabe to see if he will represent him on each of these cases.
Defendant responds.
Defendant questions if he can request a bond modification today.
Court responds and informs him that he will need to file a motion to modify his bond.

BY THE COURT:

Bond is continued

2:45 PM Defendant Justin J Korntved not in court.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.
Court reviews the case.
Court does not think issuing a warrant is appropriate and states reasons on the record.
State is in agreement with the recommendations of the Court for adjourning.

BY THE COURT:
Court will not authorize a warrant

records.addlTxt:
2:21 PM Defendant Justin J Korntved in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court makes statements to the defendant.
Defendant had been informed on March 14, 2022 that he had the right to contact the public defender's office.
Defendant is currently represented by Atty Adam Raabe on another case.
Atty Raabe has not been appointed on this case.
Defendant is to go to Branch 1.
ADA Mutchler responds with regards to the appointment of Atty Adam Raabe.
Defendant is informed by the Court that if he is determined to be ineligible for public defender representation that he can then file a petition for a court appointed attorney and this process is explained on the record. 

BY THE COURT:
Defendant is to make application to the public defender's office.
Bond is continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

BOND AMENDED 3/14/2022 from $1,500 cash to $500 cash.  
Conditions remain: 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Participate in the pre-trial supervision program.

1:44 PM Defendant Justin J Korntved appeared by video, in custody. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin, ADA Brian Pfeil, appeared in court. 

Defendant states that he is represented by counsel.
No attorney has filed a notice of retainer on this case.
Defendant has not contacted the public defenders office to appoint counsel for this case.
Defendant is heard on his bond.
ADA Pfeil responds to the request of defendant's bond modification.  ADA Pfeil objects. 
Court questions the defendant and if they should believe that he will not violate his bond conditions.
Defendant responds and states that he does not have the large cash bond to post.l


BY THE COURT:
Court adjourns 
Cash bond is amended to a lower cash bond of $500
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Initial Appearance set for March 14, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andy Mutchler appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Atty Soule states that the defendant is ineligible for public defender representation.
Court makes statements regarding the defendant getting an attorney.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule makes arguments as to bond. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for: March 14th @ 1:15 p.m. in Branch 1.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Participate in the pre-trial supervision program.
